org.latency4j.util

Class FileUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.util.FileUtilities

  • public final class FileUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

    A utility class for performing file I/O operations.

    See Also:
    StreamReadWriteUtilities

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String TMP_FOLDER_PROPERTY
      Key to java system property which points to the location of the system temp folder.

    • Field Detail

      • TMP_FOLDER_PROPERTY

        public static final java.lang.String TMP_FOLDER_PROPERTY

        Key to java system property which points to the location of the system temp folder. The value of this property is "java.io.tmpdir".

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getSystemTempFolder

        public static java.io.File getSystemTempFolder()

        Returns a reference to the system folder designated for storing temporary files. This differs across platforms, but is identified by the value of the Java property "java.io.tmpdir".

        Returns:
        A File handle to the folder identified by the Java property "java.io.tmpdir".

      • tryAndDeleteFolder

        public static boolean tryAndDeleteFolder(java.io.File candidateFolder)

        Recursively deletes the contents of the specified folder, and, if successful, the folder itself. This method circumvents the Java limitation of not being able to delete non-empty directories.

        Note: That if this method is applied to a file, the file is simply deleted.

        Parameters:
        candidateFolder - The folder to delete.
        Returns:
        True if the folder is successfully deleted, and False otherwise.

      • readLinesFromFile

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readLinesFromFile(java.io.File inputFile,
                                                                 java.lang.String delimiter)

        Reads the contents of the specified file into a list of strings, where each entry in the list represents a line in the input file. Line-breaks are identified by the value of the delimiter parameter.

        Parameters:
        inputFile - The file to be read.
        delimiter - A character which denotes the line delimiter used in the input file.
        Returns:
        A list of strings, where each element in the list corresponds to a line in the input file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurred opening or reading the specified file.
        See Also:
        StreamReadWriteUtilities.readLinesFromStream(InputStream,String, int)

      • readFileContentsAsBytes

        public static byte[] readFileContentsAsBytes(java.io.File inputFile)

        Reads the contents of the specified file into a byte array.

        Parameters:
        inputFile - The file to be read.
        Returns:
        The contents of the specified file, as a byte array.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs while reading the file.

      • writeLinesToFile

        public static void writeLinesToFile(java.io.File file,
                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines,
                                    java.lang.String eolDelimeter)

        Appends a list of strings to a file, where each element in the list is treated as a separate line in the destination file. Each line is terminated with the specified end-of-line character, with the exception of the last line in the list.

        Note that if the specified file does not exist, this method will create the file and all missing parent directories.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to which the data is to be written.
        lines - The lines to be written to file.
        eolDelimeter - The line delimiter to be used in formatting the output data.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs performing I/O operations against the specified file.
        See Also:
        writeBytesToFile(File, byte[]), writeBytesToFile(File, byte[], boolean)

      • writeBytesToFile

        public static void writeBytesToFile(java.io.File file,
                                    byte[] data)

        Writes the specified byte array to the specified file. It will create the file and any parent directories if it does not already exist. Where the file does exist, it will simply append the data to it.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to which to write data to.
        data - The data to be written to file.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an I/O error occurs accessing or writing to the file.
        See Also:
        writeBytesToFile(File, byte[], boolean), writeLinesToFile(File, List, String)

      • writeBytesToFile

        public static void writeBytesToFile(java.io.File file,
                                    byte[] data,
                                    boolean append)

        Writes the contents of the byte array to the specified file. Unlike writeBytesToFile(File, byte[]), this method allows you to control whether or not the target file is overwritten with the new data or if the data is simply appended to it. In all other respects, it is similar to writeBytesToFile(File, byte[]). Specifically, it will also create the file and any non-existent parent directories where these do not already exist.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to which the data is to be written.
        data - The data to write to the output file.
        append - Indicates if the data should be appended to the file, should the file already exist, or if its contents should be overwritten.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an exception occurs while writing the data to the output file.
        See Also:
        StreamReadWriteUtilities.writeBytesToStream(java.io.OutputStream, byte[])
